recipes: The reckoners are out in force tonight! I hear their whistles and their finger-snapping at every corner. But I've made it to the station just ahead of their enforcers.
Let's hope I don't have to resort to violence.
I've begun. [Keep an eye on the Operation. Complications will arise along the way.]
This is what I came for.
FNORD [Three Momentum means success. There'll be complications before that.]

@#ee.Devourer|A creature of crushing strength lairs here!
#ee.soldiers|Armed men guard this place. 
#ee.mist|The Nameless Name of the Velvet has passed this way. This mist is the hem of her grey garment. It'll be hell to find a way through.
#|A complication lies ahead.@

[Most Complications can be defeated with enough of the appropriate Aspect.]

@#ee.devourer|A creature of crushing strength lairs here. I'm more a match for it.
#ee.soldiers| Noisy, messy, necessary. Now I'll have to clean my boots.
#|I've used force.@

@#ee.mist|Once again, fire and ingenuity have served me well.
#ee.securevault|I've breached the vault.
#|I've used ingenuity.@

@#ee.soldiers|I've come to an arrangement with the soldiers guarding this place.
#|I've used bribery.@

@#ee.mist|The Watchman comes before the Velvet' is the kind of thing adepts say. I think it means that mist is only really a damper sort of darkness.
#|I've dissolved a darkness.@

@#ee.devourer|A creature of crushing strength lairs here. I can't face it head-on, so I've turned to trickery.
#ee.soldiers|The soldiers who should be guarding this place have gone thundering off into the night. I'll have just enough time to finish here before they get back -
#|I've used trickery.@
Someone else would have given up. [Occasionally, you'll defeat a Complication even if you lack the right Aspects.]
My accomplice has chosen this moment to ask for a larger share than we'd agreed.
I've disposed of my associate. A pity, but I won't be made a fool of like that.
My loyalty is to the Lionsmith, the Colonel's eternal enemy. I am not welcome here.
My loyalty is to the Colonel, the Lionsmith's eternal enemy. I am not welcome here.
Not today. I walk on, whistling a tune I thought I'd forgotten.  [You can't make use of a shrine to either the Lionsmith or the Colonel while you have Tranquillity on the board.]
The power honoured here might accept a certain vow. But you would gain nothing from that just yet. [Try this again once you have a Defiance Temptation on the table.]
A consecration to the powers of conflict is irrevocable as a scar or a betrayal. [You cannot be consecrated twice.]
This should trigger only if neither Consecration recipe does.
I've spent decades staying out of the Hours' way. Perhaps it's time to change that.
Make a Pilgrimage to an Iron Shrine, for a Revelation
The Colonel's shrines sometimes smell of gunpowder, and sometimes of snow. Meditation here will improve my understanding of the techniques the Colonel's Names teach.

The shadows of the shrine thicken. I am blind as the Colonel. I cannot see the Name Quirinus, who stands before me with his two-headed spear. 'Child of Earth,' he whispers, 'here is wisdom for you.' [You have learnt one of your Foe's weaknesses.]
Make a Pilgrimage to an Iron Shrine

The Colonel's shrines sometimes smell of gunpowder, and sometimes of snow. Meditation here will improve my understanding of the techniques the Colonel's Names teach. [Each Colonel meditation gives you a Wound.]
The rites cost blood, every time. In my delirium, as I lie half-conscious in the shrine, I think I hear the Many-Winged Ones whispering in the rafters. 'Blood returns to the earth. Blood returns...'
The Colonel's shrines sometimes smell of gunpowder, and sometimes of snow. I can learn more of the battle-mysteries of the Edge here.
My bones creak. My hearing seems sharper.
I've spent decades staying out of the Hours' way. Perhaps it's time to change that.
Make a Pilgrimage to a Brazen Shrine, for a Revelation

The Lionsmith's shrines are bright with the scent of hot brass, and rank with the scent of big cats. I have mastered his mysteries. If I meditate in his shrine, perhaps I will hear his voice. [Each Lionsmith meditation creates a Rage.]

The sunlight falls in my eyes like blood, and all I see is the gold. The Name Menhit stands growling in the light, though I cannot see her. 'Child of Earth!' she hisses. 'Hear me!' [You have learnt one of your Foe's weaknesses.]
Make a Pilgrimage to a Brazen Shrine

The Lionsmith's shrines are bright with the scent of hot brass, and rank with the scent of big cats. Meditation here will improve my understanding of the techniques the Lionsmith's Names teach. [Each Lionsmith meditation creates a Rage.]

My strength overwhelms my thoughts, and I circle the shrine, growling like a beast. Through the haze of my rage I think I hear the Many-Winged Ones whispering in the rafters. 'The strength of the earth. Of the earth...'
The Lionsmith's shrines are bright with the scent of hot brass, and rank with the scent of big cats. I can learn more of the battle-techniques of the Edge here.
I could dedicate myself to the Colonel. [This will harm you and limit your dealings with the Lionsmith, but increase Defiance and open the Colonel's mysteries.]
I have masked my eyes and scarred my skin. I have bound myself with the Nine Patient Oaths. I am a soldier of the Colonel, who will not release me.
I could dedicate myself to the Lionsmith. [This will enrage you and limit your dealings with the Colonel, but increase Defiance, and open the Lionsmith's mysteries.]
I have spilt the beast's blood and scorched my skin. I have undergone the Three Valorous Trials. I am a warrior of the Lionsmith, unless some day he releases me.

I might choose to take the Unflinching Vow, which demands tenacity at no matter what cost. [This will give you a Wound, and make it impossible to win the game with an Obscurity victory, but will increase your Defiance.]
'Each torment is a lesson. Each scar is a weapon. There is no defeat but annihilation.'

I might choose to take the Brazen Vow, which demands boldness in even the direst circumstances. [This will give you a Rage, and make it impossible to win the game with an Obscurity victory, but will increase your Defiance.]
'From valour, strength. From strength, valour. There is no defeat but shame.'
I need to move on. [You might end up anywhere.]
My blood seethes at the thought of running again. Unless this fury subsides, I can only turn and fight. [You can't leave a city while you're experiencing Rage.]
This is only a hint, so the Wilderness recipe will override it.

My train leaves at dawn. Have I forgotten anything? [This is a destination at the Map's Edge. There's no onward travel. Once you arrive, you'll need to be ready to end this business. You will leave everything behind, including any Allies.]

This is a last resort. I'll be easier to track outside the safety of crowds. I don't know the lie of the land. I might easily die an undignified death. [You can only take Portable Assets with you. Departure will end all ongoing reckoner actions and remove all Traces, but it will also abandon Assets, Locations, Destinations, Local Contacts, and ongoing Operations.]
You can leave wilderness even if you have outstanding Rage. I'm not a monster.
Prepare to Depart for a Remote Destination

My train leaves at dawn. Have I forgotten anything? [You can only take Portable Assets with you. Departure will end all ongoing reckoner actions and remove all Traces, but it will also abandon Assets, Locations, Destinations, Local Contacts, and ongoing Operations.]

Time to go. Have I forgotten anything? [You can only take Portable Assets with you. Departure will end all ongoing reckoner actions and remove all Traces, but it will also abandon Assets, Locations, Destinations, Local Contacts, and ongoing Operations.]
This is a Remote destination. I'll need sufficient Cash to pay my way.
I'll need Cash to pay my way.

Time to go. Have I forgotten anything? [You can only take Portable Assets with you. Departure will end all ongoing reckoner actions and remove all Traces, but it will also abandon Assets, Locations, Destinations, Local Contacts, and ongoing Operations.]
I may need this. [You can take anything Portable with you, but it'll lengthen your preparations.]
This is as far as my allies will go. Time to say goodbye.

Deleting the rkx verb and then recreating it with the alt works fine because effect execution occurs in turn inside each recipe, and alt additional=true
gives us another recipe. But keep an eye on this.
Through the darkness into a new day. I've gone far enough that the reckoners will have to look harder than usual. Unless they're already here?
Always run this after a travel attempt! It converts packed assets back into assets.
The sun crosses the sky. Night pursues it.
No enemies arrive in the first turn.

The sun crosses the sky. Night pursues it. [At the end of each cycle, reckoners may also enter the city. This is more likely if you've created a Trace, and much more likely if you've created more than one.]
using linked recipes so we can select just one possible additional trace response
The sky is going. Then everything else will. [If you still have seven Wounds when this completes, you'll die.]
If Truth is Time's daughter, whose child is Forgetfulness? [You have gained Obscurity.]
It's hard to pass through the world and leave no footprints. [Reckoners use Traces to find you.]
